content.description:
Sit down boulder problem. Flat dirt landing with small trees about,... steep South facing wedged face,..

Start sitting with both hands on a good right facing rail. Smear feet on a couple of small holds,.. and, huck for the lip. Stick it, and establish both hands on the lip,.. then do a heel hook and a mantle move to surmount.
content.protection: A bouldering pad,.. if one feels so inclined...
content.location: Directly uphill from Cronin's Arete. Amidst a sowing of medium size boulders.

content.description:
Amazingly good, especially for how short it is.

Start sitting awkwardly on a sloping landing, with your feet on smeary nubs and your hands on smeary slopers. Get rhythm, and fly to the sloper!

Mind you don't dab on the swing. Finish on the classic, and more moderate topout.

Spectacular movement in a nice, tight little package. Also, great name.
content.location: The Dead Worms area, if we are calling it that, is found from a small spur trail in upper hill. As you come up the hill, you pass High Life, Cronin's Arete. Uphill from Cronin's arete, you will cut through a couple of rock jumbles. Keep looking to your right. There will be a small spur trail that leads under a tight squeeze between overhanging boulder and tree branches. Cut across the slab, and avoid falling down a steep gully, and you will see Big Time on your left.
